question: 当てる
sourceAnswer: to{} hit | expose | apply-(e.g.-patch)/put-on/put-against/hold-on/hold-against | allot/call-on-someone-(e.g.-in-class) | guess-(an-answer) | make-a-hit-(e.g.-in-a-lottery)
userAnswer: to{} hit | expose | apply/put-on | guess | call-on(in-class)
activeAnswer: to{} hit | expose | apply/put-on | guess | call-on(in-class)
sourceMnemonic: You know that the kanji <ja>当</ja> means <kanji>right</kanji> or <kanji>success</kanji>. So since this is a verb, you're doing right and success (which doesn't make much sense). Instead, you're guessing something and getting it right. So, this word means <vocabulary>to guess</vocabulary> something. Hopefully you don't have to guess too hard when it comes to the meaning of this word as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading can be remembered via the word <ja>当たる</ja> which you learned a few levels ago. Use that knowledge to remember that this word is read as <ja>あてる</ja>. The important part is the <ja>あ</ja>.
